docs.title: Welcome to the School Governance Hub
docs.text:
The single source of truth for Data Protection, IT Security, and Operational Standards.

Urgent: Need to Report a Data Breach?

If you suspect a data leak, lost a device, or found sensitive files exposed, do not wait.

  • Step 1: Disconnect the device from the network (if applicable).
  • Step 2: Click here to follow the Incident Response Procedure immediately.
  • Step 3: Contact the Data Protection Officer (DPO) at dpo@yourschool.edu.

docs.title: 🎯 How to use this Portal
docs.text:
This hub replaces our old scattered PDF files. It is designed for speed and searchability. You can use the Search Bar (top of the page) or browse the core sections below:

  • Governance & Strategy

    Start here for the "Big Picture." Our commitment to Vietnam's Decree 13 (PDPL), our internal regulations, and the responsibilities of the Leadership Team.

    View Internal Regulations

  • Policies & Standards

    The rules we live by. Covers Data Protection, Acceptable Use of Technology, and Staff Codes of Conduct.

    Browse Policy Library

  • Procedures & Playbooks

    Step-by-step guides for daily tasks. How to handle subject access requests, onboard new staff securely, or manage vendor contracts.

    View Procedures

docs.title: 🔒 Our Commitment to Privacy
docs.text:
As an educational institution, we hold the most valuable data in the world: the identities and futures of our students.

In compliance with Vietnam Decree No. 13/2023/ND-CP, this portal establishes the technical and organizational measures we take to protect that data. Compliance is not just a legal checkbox; it is a promise of safety to our community.

docs.title: Key Principles
docs.text:
1. Transparency: We do not hide how we use data.
  2. Minimization: We collect only what we need.
  3. Security: We protect data as if it were our own.

Need Help?

For questions regarding these policies or to request a new document, please contact the Compliance Office at extension 101 or email compliance@yourschool.edu.

docs.title: Internal Regulations on Personal Data Protection
docs.text: Effective Date: September 2024 Legal Basis: Vietnam Decree No. 13/2023/ND-CP

docs.title: 1. Purpose
docs.text: This document serves as the supreme internal regulation regarding the processing of personal data at ABC International School. It defines our legal obligations as a Data Controller and Data Processor.

docs.title: 2. Roles & Responsibilities
docs.text: Role Responsibility Data Controller The School Board. Determines why and how data is used. Data Protection Officer (DPO) Responsible for monitoring compliance and liaising with the Ministry of Public Security. Staff Member Any employee handling student or parent data.

docs.title: 3. Data Subject Rights
docs.text:
Under Article 9 of Decree 13, all students, parents, and staff have the right to: 1. Know how their data is being processed. 2. Consent or withdraw consent at any time. 3. Request deletion of their data (unless required by law).

Non-Compliance

Failure to adhere to these regulations may result in disciplinary action and personal liability under Vietnamese law.

docs.title: Compliance Roadmap (2024-2025)
docs.text: This dashboard tracks our journey toward full Decree 13 compliance.

docs.title: 🚀 Phase 1: Foundation (Q3 2024)
docs.text:
• [x] Appoint Data Protection Officer (DPO)
  • [x] Conduct initial Data Inventory (Data Mapping)
  • [ ] Publish Internal Regulations

docs.title: 🛡️ Phase 2: Implementation (Q4 2024)
docs.text:
• [ ] Roll out MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) for all staff
  • [ ] Sign Data Processing Agreements (DPAs) with vendors
  • [ ] Train HR and Admissions teams on "Sensitive Data"

docs.title: 🔍 Phase 3: Audit & Review (Q1 2025)
docs.text:
• [ ] Conduct Transfer Impact Assessment (TIA) for overseas data
  • [ ] External Security Audit

docs.title: 1. Data Classification Matrix
docs.text:
We classify data into two tiers as required by law.

Classification Definition Examples Security Requirement Basic Data General identification info. Name, DOB, Personal Email, Citizenship. Password Protection. Sensitive Data Data causing harm if leaked. Health records, Financial status, Biometrics, Religion. Encrypted & Audit Logged.

docs.title: 2. Data Minimization Principle
docs.text:
The Golden Rule

"If you do not need it for a specific educational purpose, do not collect it."

docs.title: 3. Storage Rules
docs.text:
• Physical: All sensitive paper files must be in locked cabinets. Keys are restricted to authorized personnel.
  • Digital: Sensitive data must NOT be stored on local desktops or USB drives. Use only the approved School Management System.

docs.title: 1. Handling Recruitment Data
docs.text:
• CVs of unsuccessful candidates must be deleted after 6 months unless specific consent is obtained to keep them on file.
  • Interview notes are considered personal data and must be stored securely.

docs.title: 2. Employee Records
docs.text: Staff have the right to inspect their own personnel file. Requests must be fulfilled within 72 hours.

docs.title: 1. Password Standards
docs.text:
• Minimum length: 12 characters.
  • Must be changed every 90 days.
  • Prohibited: Sharing passwords with colleagues or students.

docs.title: 2. Zalo & Chat Apps
docs.text:
Strict Prohibition

Sending files containing Sensitive Personal Data (e.g., Student IDs, Medical Reports) via Zalo, Viber, or Messenger is strictly prohibited.

Use the official School Email or Document Portal instead.

docs.title: 3. Device Security
docs.text:
• All laptops must have BitLocker encryption enabled.
  • Screens must be locked (Windows + L) when leaving your desk.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Parents and staff can request to see, correct, or delete their data. We have 72 hours to acknowledge these requests.

docs.title: Step 1: Verification
docs.text:
Check Identity

Ensure the person requesting the data is actually who they say they are. * In Person: Check ID Card. * Email: Verify the email address matches our records. call to confirm if unsure.

docs.title: Step 2: Locate Data
docs.text: Check the following systems: * School Management System (SIS) * Admissions CRM * Clinic Records

docs.title: Step 3: Response
docs.text: Send the data via the Secure Transfer Tool. Do not attach raw Excel files to standard emails.

docs.title: Incident Response Playbook
docs.text: Follow this workflow immediately if you suspect a data breach.

docs.title: Response Workflow
docs.text:
graph TD
    A["🔴 START: Breach Detected"] --> B{"Is Personal Data Involved?"}
    B -- No --> C["Log as IT Incident"]
    B -- Yes --> D{"Is it Sensitive Data?"}
    D -- Yes --> E["⚡ URGENT: Notify DPO within 1 Hour"]
    D -- No --> F["Notify IT Support"]
    E --> G["DPO Reports to Ministry (72h)"]
    F --> H["Investigate & Contain"]
    G --> H
    H --> I["🟢 END: Post-Incident Review"]
